description.plain:
John Clayton Mayer, born October 16, 1977, is a singer-songwriter and guitarist whose work has spanned many genres over the course of his career. Raised in Fairfield, Connecticut, he attended the prestigious Berklee College of Music, hoping to refine his guitar skills. He dropped out after one year to pursue his career.

After striking a deal with Aware/Columbia Records, he released his debut album, Room for Squares in 2001. The single “Your Body Is a Wonderland” launched him to fame, winning him a Grammy Award for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance in 2003. That same year, he released his second album Heavier Things, spawning the single “Daughters”, which won Song of the Year in 2005.

After performing soft rock/pop in his early career, he began moving towards the blues genre that had initially influenced him as a musician, collaborating with B.B. King and Eric Clapton among others. In 2005, he formed the blues group John Mayer Trio, releasing Try! that same year. Mayer’s 2006 album Continuum continued his foray into the blues genre and won him Grammy for Best Pop Vocal Album in 2007, producing the hit singles “Waiting on the World to Change” and “Gravity”.

His 2009 album Battle Studies saw a return to pop rock and a number-one grossing world tour. Mayer withdrew from public life in 2010 after controversial interviews with Playboy and Rolling Stone and began work on his fifth studio album Born and Raised, released in 2012. The album is a shift in sound for Mayer, incorporating folk and country rock. A granuloma on his vocal chords delayed the release of the album and cancelled the subsequent tour.

In 2013, John released Paradise Valley and during a concert in Adelaide, he covered the Beyoncé song “XO” and one month later, he released a studio version of the song. In August 2015, Mayer and the Grateful Dead formed the group Dead & Company, along with Jeff Chimenti and Oteil Burbridge and they began a tour in the US that continued in 2016. In November of the same year, John released the lead single “Love on the Weekend” of his seventh studio album The Search For Everything, out in 2017.

description.plain:
“Gravity” is a song by John Mayer, which was featured on three different releases: Try! with John Mayer Trio in 2005; the album Continuum in 2006; and finally in 2008 on the live album, Where The Light Is.

The studio version of the song was the third single taken from Continuum, released on January 31, 2007.

description.plain:
“Slow Dancing In A Burning Room” is the eighth track on Continuum. It has since becoming one of Mayer’s most enduring hits, loved amongst fans for its highly emotional lyrics and impassioned guitar solo.

Mayer combines two separate images to create his title (and lyrical hook):


The burning room, a symbol of their relationship, communicates the chaos and destruction of their current state.
The slow dancing, a symbol of both their complacency and their initial love, communicates their lack of success in finding a solution for their problems. Though their love is passionate, as evidenced by the tone of Mayer’s doomed lover, it’s riddled with practical problems that can only result in the collapse of their relationship.



Thus, Mayer constructs the central image of one of his most emotional songs, detailing the inevitable breakdown of a relationship as something akin to a fatalistic dance.

description.plain:
In the Blood is the fifth song on John Mayer’s The Search for Everything.

Sheryl Crow is doing the background vocals, although she’s not being officially credited for it.

In an interview with a member from MyStupidMouth, a John Mayer community forum, John told us:

There’s a song on the record called In the Blood. I can’t think of another one of my songs that more distinctly affects people — where you could put it on and no matter what kind of music you like, no matter your philosophy, you’d still say, ‘I have to hear that again.’  It’s really big and when I say that, I’ll never mean commercial.  I mean people will want to talk to me about it and people will say they felt something there.

description.plain:
“You’re Gonna Live Forever In Me” holds the promise of a legacy. John considers the impact that a special person has had on his life, claiming that “parts of [him] were made by [them].”

John’s personality is a product of the subject’s companionship, and John promises that influence will never die. In between a whistling intro and outro, Mayer invokes images of mass-extinction and “destiny” to prove his commitment.

The track was included in the first batch of songs released off the album, alongside “Moving On And Getting Over,” “Changing” and “Love On The Weekend.” The album was released in sets of four tracks – sets which were released monthly.

description.plain:
The funky tune finds John struggling to get over his ex, despite the length of time he still has her on his mind but he acknowledges that is time to move over and get a new girl.

John Mayer debuted “Movin On and Getting Over” during an intimate live show in Los Angeles, days before the release of The Search for Everything:
https://twitter.com/JohnMayer/status/816771656030961664

description.plain:
With the same name as the second single from Paradise Valley, “Wildfire” and making this the duo’s second song together after White on channel ORANGE.
The song conjures a striking image of a woman jumping from the Eiffel Tower.

description.plain:
On “Still Feel Like Your Man”, John confesses that he’s not over his ex-girlfriend, Katy Perry. He confirmed this with the New York Times, saying:

Who else would I be thinking about?
And by the way, it’s a testament to the fact that I have not dated a lot of people in the last five, six years. That was my only relationship. So it’s like, give me this, people.

A piano flourish opens the song that turns into a funky tune, keeping the trend of Wave One’s opener “Moving On and Getting Over”;
Mayer told the Rolling Stone that he spent more hours improving the song than any he’s ever recorded, he worked to make the song “really punch but also really freaky,” and to give a vibe John calls “ancient Japanese R&B.”

The track premiered on April 7, 2015 during a secret live show at the Hotel Café in Los Angeles.

description.plain:
“Waiting on the World to Change” centers John and his generation’s inaction in regard to current world conditions as the youth feel powerless in this situation. They feel as though they don’t have the means to fight because they are young and to some degree ignorant and scared.

He also laments the corruption among leaders,
John confirmed this feeling of discontent between the leaders and during an interview with The Advocate, explains:

“It’s saying, ‘Well, I’ll just watch American Idol because I know that if I were engaged in changing anything for the better, or the better as I see it, it would go unnoticed or be completely ineffective.’ A lot of people have that feeling.”

The song is the first single released from John Mayer’s 2006 studio album, Continuum. It won the Grammy for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance at the 49th Grammy Awards.

description.plain:
“Paper Doll” was believed to be a 3 year late response track to John’s ex girlfriend Taylor Swift’s 2010 record about him, “Dear John.” This was unanimously believed to be true for almost 6 years until in 2019 when John Mayer spoke about the song “Paper Doll” on his Instagram talk show “Current Mood.” In it, John stated that “Paper Doll” was a song of his that he felt didn’t get the love it deserved and that it wasn’t who people thought it was about.

Regardless, there still appear to be several direct lyrical tie-ins between “Paper Doll” and “Dear John”:

John directly replies to Taylor’s line, “you paint me a blue sky then go back and turn it to rain” with, “and if those angel wings don’t fly, someone’s going to paint you another sky.”

John directly replies to Taylor’s line, “and I look back in regret how I ignored when they said, run as fast as you can” with, “you’re like twenty-two girls in one, and none of them know what they’re running from”. This line also draws reference to Taylor’s 2012 song, “22”.

John also publicly commented to Rolling Stone in 2012 about Taylor’s “Dear John”, saying it “humiliated” him and “made me feel terrible,” a year before the release of “Paper Doll.”

The two notably collaborated on Mayer’s 2010 song “Half of My Heart,” which was released 4 months before “Dear John”.

description.plain:
‘Rosie’ is the tenth song from John Mayer’s The Search for Everything and forms a perfect follow-up song to ‘Never On The Day You Leave’, which is about realizing what you had, after losing it.

‘Rosie’ is about regretting breaking up with somebody, but realising that just a little bit late.

Rosie is the name of the ex-girlfriend of the narrator of the song. The narrator shows up at her door, drunk and heartbroken, and asks for her to take him back. He doesn’t seem to aknowledge that it is a lost cause, but that’s what drinks do to a heartbroken man.

description.plain:
“In Your Atmosphere,” also known as “L.A. Song,” is a song written and performed by John Mayer. It tells the story of a heartbroken Mayer, who wants to avoid the hometown of his, presumably, former lover.

The song was never published until Mayer’s 2008 live album titled Where the Light Is.

He told a live audience in Birmingham, Alabama, during his Battle Studies tour, that he wrote the song on a tour bus.

description.plain:
A melancholy love song, “Emoji of a Wave” describes the hardships of living apart in a relationship.

John describes life as a “wave” – a force beyond his control that knocks him about. In choosing to “hold on” he embraces the unpredictability of life, playing down the heartbreak and fear such unpredictability holds. Even though he knows that they’ll “be ok,” it still “breaks [his] heart” to be apart from her.

description.plain:
“Love on the Weekend” is the lead single off John Mayer’s new album The Search For Everything. The song marks his return to pop-rock music which is reminiscent of 2001’s Room for Squares. In it, he sings about how excited he is to meet up with his love interest, taking her on a special weekend trip.

Speculation about new music began in October, after John tweeted:
https://twitter.com/JohnMayer/status/788851144214929408

It’s John Mayer’s first new single since he covered  Beyoncè’s “XO,” back in 2014. He premiered the song with a Facebook live session and fan Q&A.

description.plain: The ninth track on John Mayer’s Battle Studies, “Edge of Desire,” is a portrayal of feelings that are somewhat ignored by contemporary music. Mayer emphasizes and seems attached to the word “desire” for a reason, being that the word “desire” accesses feelings that words such as “want” or “need” do not. This seems to be a common theme throughout Battle Studies, and “Edge of Desire,” to many, is an unchallenged contender at the most representative song of Battle Studies.

description.plain:
“Your Body Is a Wonderland” is a song written and recorded by American singer-songwriter John Mayer. It was released in October 2002 as the second single from his debut studio album, Room for Squares (2001). Its commercial success was greater than Mayer’s prior single, “No Such Thing.”

There has been speculation that Mayer wrote the song about actress Jennifer Love Hewitt, whom he dated in 2002, but she denied it.  Mayer stated that he wrote the song about his first girlfriend at age 14.

 In 2002, “Your Body Is a Wonderland” won the Grammy Award for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance.

description.plain:
“Carry Me Away” is John’s first single in a little less than a year, following his previous single “I Guess I Just Feel Like”.

The song was announced on Instagram a week before it’s release, with John saying that it described his Summer Vacation.

It is a groovy track that sounds much different from John’s previous songs, and as far as John’s songs go, it is rather short. It describes how John wants to start a new relationship as he feels as if “[he’s] a bore”. The listener never figures out if he gets the relationship he is longing for or not.

description.plain:
“Who Says” is the first single from Mayer’s fourth studio album, Battle Studies. It is an acoustic ode to the feeling of freedom from the stresses of life – an idea Mayer has previously addressed.

In regard to the controversial lyrics implying marijuana use, Mayer told Rolling Stone, “When I sing it, I do not think about marijuana — I think about walking around your house naked with a guitar. It’s about being in control of the pleasure in your life.”

description.plain:
There’s a song called Never on the Day You Leave that is just the saddest song I ever wrote.  It’s about guys and how guys work in regret and it’s never on the day you leave and you can figure out the rest from the title.

My Stupid Mouth, 2015

John has said that he doesn’t play this song live, do to the fact its too emotional for him to preform. He wrote the song after going through a rough time in his life after a breakup.

description.plain:
The song was originally released by Beyoncé on her 2013 self-titled Album. It was the lead single for the album, being released to digital resellers on December 16, 2013.
“XO” was originally written by Ryan Tedder, Terius Nash and Beyoncé Knowles.

John Mayer first covered the song in April 2014 during one of his shows in Adelaide, Australia. On May 22 he released a studio version of the song on his Soundcloud account featuring only guitar, harmonica and piano. It was made available for download from digital retailers on May 27.

Mayer later thanked Beyoncé for “her blessing” and stated the song being inspiring for his next album in “very important ways”.

description.plain: “Born and Raised” is the title track of Mayer’s 2012 album. Through this song Mayer shares realization that he no longer has a lifetime of dreams and goals to look forward to – he is already an adult who has a passed a good chunk of his life. Not only that, but he realizes he has reached this point largely on his own, which has sapped the joy out of the journey.

Not only that, but he realizes he has reached this point largely on his own, which has sapped the joy out of the journey.

But all at once it gets hard to take

Because one of these days I'll be born and raised
And it’s such a waste to grow up lonely

I still have dreams, they’re not the same
They don’t fly as high as they used to

And he said, “You don’t remember me do you?”

But all at once it gets hard to take

Because one of these days I'll be born and raised
And it’s such a waste to grow up lonely

Still got time, still got faith
I call on both of my brothers
Got a mom, got a dad
But they do not have each other

So line on up and take your place
Show your face to the morning
Because one of these days you’ll be
Born and raised and it
All comes up without warning

description.plain:
This song was originally written during the sessions for Born and Raised, per a 2013 My Stupid Mouth interview


“There was a song called Helpless for Born and Raised that I adored. Everybody did not like it. It was one of the only times where my compass was off.

I loved that tune, man. It was great. ‘If I’m helpless / tell me now / tell me now / and I’ll stop trying to figure it out.’ It was mean and it was cool. I’ve just made enough records now to know during the making of the record what is going to congeal and what is not."


The track is led by a retro guitar line which is reminescent, according to Rolling Stone, of the late 70s and early 80s Stones tracks, and it’s one of the few songs on the album John recorded live in the studio.

description.plain:
“Neon” is about a girl that he’s into who loves to drink and get wasted in general. The song is called Neon because, like the neon lights they see every time they go out in the city, “she’s always buzzing.”

The song is another good example of Mayer’s appealingly multifaceted style, with its dichotomy between a funky groove and its appealing pop sensibility.

description.plain: In this song, from Born and Raised, Mayer tells the story of a man, Walt Grace, who decided to leave his family and friends sailing away in a submarine. Walt Grace represents John Mayer who took a break in his career after his PlayBoy and Rolling Stone interviews from 2010. John got off the spotlight for sometime.

body.plain: In this song, from Born and Raised, Mayer tells the story of a man, Walt Grace, who decided to leave his family and friends sailing away in a submarine. Walt Grace represents John Mayer who took a break in his career after his PlayBoy and Rolling Stone interviews from 2010. John got off the spotlight for sometime.

songs.lyrics:
Walt Grace
Desperately hating his whole place
Dreamed to discover a new space
And buried himself alive
Inside his basement
Tongue on the side of his face meant
He's working away on displacement
And what it would take to survive

Because when you're done with this world
You know the next is up to you
And his wife told his kids he was crazy
And his friends said he'd fail if he'd try

But with the will to work hard
And a library card
He took a homemade, fan-blade
One-man submarine ride

That morning
The sea was mad and I mean it
Waves as big as he'd seen it
Deep in his dreams at home
From dry land
He rolled it over to wet sand
Closed the hatch up with one hand
And peddled off alone

Cause when you're done with this world
You know the next is up to you
And for once in his life it was quiet
As he learned how to turn in the tide

And the sky was a flare
As he came up for air
In his homemade, fan-blade
One-man submarine ride

One evening
When weeks had passed since he's leaving
The call she planned on receiving
Finally made it home
She accepted
The news she never expected
The operator connected
The call from Tokyo

Cause when you're done with this world
You know the next is up to you
Now his friends bring him up when they're drinking
At the bar with his name on the side

And they smile when they can
As they speak of the man
Who took a homemade, fan-blade
One-man submarine ride

description.plain:
‘Why Georgia’ is the second track and third single release from John Mayer’s debut album Room For Squares.

John wrote the song when he was living in Atlanta, Georgia. In the song, he states that he is willing to leave everything behind in order to become successful.

body.plain:
‘Why Georgia’ is the second track and third single release from John Mayer’s debut album Room For Squares.

John wrote the song when he was living in Atlanta, Georgia. In the song, he states that he is willing to leave everything behind in order to become successful.

songs.lyrics:
I am driving up '85 in the
Kind of morning that lasts all afternoon
Just stuck inside the gloom
4 more exits to my apartment but
I am tempted to keep the car in drive
And leave it all behind

Because I wonder sometimes
About the outcome
Of a still verdictless life

Am I living it right?
Am I living it right?
Am I living it right?
Why Georgia, why?

I rent a room and I fill the spaces with
Wood in places to make it feel like home
But all I feel's alone
It might be a quarter life crisis
Or just the stirring in my soul

Either way--I wonder sometimes
About the outcome
Of a still verdictless life

Am I living it right?
Am I living it right?
Am I living it right?
Why Georgia, why?

So what, so I've got a smile on
But it's hiding the quiet superstitions in my head
Don't believe me
Don't believe me
When I say I've got it down

Everybody is just a stranger but
That's the danger in going my own way
I guess it's the price I have to pay

Still "everything happens for a reason"
Is no reason not to ask myself

Am I living it right?
Am I living it right?
Am I living it right?
Why? Tell me why?
Why? Why Georgia, why?

description.plain:
“Dreaming with a Broken Heart” is a song by John Mayer from his 2006 album Continuum. It was released as digital download single in July 2007.

The single entered the U.S Billboard Hot 100 chart at its peak position of #99. It also peaked on the Adult Top 40 at #8, making it Mayer’s eighth single to enter the Top 10 on Billboard’s Adult Top 40 Chart.

Billboard called the song:

… another bull’s-eye from that rare singer/songwriter who has proved to be a cinch for success.

description.plain:
“The Heart of Life” is the fifth track on Continuum.

It’s an acoustic track, not unlike “Stop This Train”, in which Mayer defends life against all of the terrible things it brings on. At the crux of it, he posits, life it good.

This track would later appear on Where The Light Is: John Mayer Live in Los Angeles, performed live as “The Heart Of Life/In Repair”

description.plain:
“Dear Marie” is a song written to a girl John used to be in a relationship with back in high school but due to him pursuing a career in music the relationship ended up ending. As mentioned in an episode of Current Mood, Marie was the only girl he dated before he was famous, and she was “the one that got away” for him; someone that he knew liked him not because he was famous, but because of who he was. In this song, he’s asking Marie what kind person he was then and if the life he chose changed him.
Marie is a real person, though not by that name, John called it a, “letter to someone that gets to no one”.

description.plain:
“Belief” is the third track and second single off Continuum. Despite being released as a single in November 2006, a music video was never produced.

Lyrically, the song details the pitfalls and dangers of belief and conviction – Mayer notes that, though it provides “armour,” belief also “makes for the heaviest sword.” It focuses specifically on the fallout from war, which is in many cases motivated by beliefs (see The Crusades and, more recently, the Korean and the Vietnam Wars).

The song notably features singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Ben Harper on guitar.

description.plain: “Say”, a single intended for the film, The Bucket List, was released on November 20, and was later added to the special edition re-release of his album, Continuum. The song is John Mayer’s highest-charting single, peaking at #12 on the Billboard Hot 10. It also earned him a Grammy for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance, making that his fourth Grammy in that category.

description.plain:
“Vultures” is the sixth track on Continuum.

It’s not the first appearance of the song, however – it appeared as a live recording on Try!, the 2005 debut album by John Mayer Trio. It is one of two songs off Continuum that featured on that album, the other being “Gravity.”. As such, the song is cowritten by Trio bandmates Steve Jordan and Pino Palladino.

It would later appear, with slightly altered lyrics, on Where The Light Is: John Mayer Live In Los Angeles.

description.plain:
John Mayer’s The Search For Everything was released monthly in groups of four tracks. “Changing” was released as a part of Wave One, the first of these mini-releases.

The track is an ode to John’s constant evolution. Whilst it’s about personal evolution and “following [one’s] heart,” Mayer’s music has also endured several notable evolutions, shifting from pop to blues to country-rock.

He’s confronted themes of change on previous releases. On 2006’s “Stop This Train,” he sings:

So scared of getting older, I’m only good at being young…

It seems that in the 11 years between then and now, John’s warmed to the idea of change.
During an Q&A on Twitter, he revealed that “Changing” was the most difficult record to write:
https://twitter.com/JohnMayer/status/838287720589881344

description.plain:
“I’m Gonna Find Another You” is the twelfth  track off Continuum. It’s the shortest song on the album, with a running time of only 2:43.

The song details Mayer’s plan to overcome his ex-girlfriend – by finding somebody with whom he feels equally as connected. It’s a melancholic end to an album that explored themes of self doubt, individual optimism and generational pessimism.

The song was originally the final track on the album, but this honour was transferred to “Say” after the album was re-released in 2008.

description.plain:
“Roll It On Home” is the closer song of Wave Two and the eleventh song on The Search for Everything, which contains a heavy country vibe.

When interviewed by Rolling Stone Magazine, John told them is about the moment you realize you’ve been at the bar so long that “tonight’s already yesterday.” He’s telling some hard truths to a friend that is going through a rough season after a break-up, he realizes that they need someone to love them, but in a bar they won’t find the love that they are looking for, so he encourages them to go on home.

The song is more in tune with John’s country folk albums Born & Raised and Paradise Valley.

description.plain:
“Clarity” was released as the second single from Mayer’s second studio album, Heavier Things. In concert, Mayer has introduced the song as one “written about the first few seconds after waking up in the morning when you don’t remember all of the problems and worries in your life.”

The song features prominent contributions from the piano and drums, the latter coming in part from The Roots' drummer Questlove.

description.plain:
Queen of California is the second single from, and first track of John Mayer’s Born and Raised.

It’s a tribute to the folk rock songs that came before, and Mayer adds his own feelings to that rich mix.

If this music strikes a chord with you, go next to listen to and read Radney Foster’s “California”.

description.plain:
John Mayer first performed I Guess I Just Feel Like on iHeartRadio on Wednesday October 24th 2018. However, the song was officially released four months later, on February 22nd 2019.

On Instagram Mayer stated:

“I Guess I Just Feel Like” is the “get small and tell the truth” I mentioned a few weeks ago. Playing this song last night was one of the best calls I’ve made in a while. Your reactions have made the weeks of working these feelings out well worth it. Conversations have begun on how and when to get an “official” version out (it’s almost done) but I kind of love pointing you to new music that’s raw and not tuned and doesn’t make anybody any money. I dunno. Thank you.

description.plain:
“Something Like Olivia” is the 5th track and 3rd single from Mayer’s Born and Raised album.

Mayer admitted this song was written in reference to his celebrity crush, actress Olivia Wilde. Presumably the singer penned this track before February 8, 2011, when the actress announced that she and her husband, filmmaker Tao Ruspoli, were separating. The theme of the song plays along the lines of a woman you want but can’t have.

Now I’m not trying to steal
No love away from no one man
But if Olivia herself were at my door
I’d have to say, I’d let her in

 You can’t blame him, can you?

description.plain:
“In Repair” is the eleventh track on Continuum.

The song is about emotional recovery, making reference to the “shadows” and “corners” of a restless mind that prevent Mayer from being his usual self.

It was cowritten with singer-songwriter Charlie Hunter, making it one of only two collaboratively written tracks on the album. It also notably features James Valentine, lead guitarist for Maroon 5 and a friend of Mayer courtesy of their shared time at Berkeley College.

description.plain:
“Comfortable” is from John Mayer’s EP Inside Wants Out, and it’s expressing a previous relationship he misses.



When asked whether this particular song pertained to any real life experiences, Mayer didn’t give a direct answer, but he did mention that all of his songs are “emotionally autobiographical, even if some aren’t line for line true to my life.”

description.plain:
“My Stupid Mouth” details a date gone horribly wrong, when Mayer said something that his date took offense of and possibly ruined his chances of a relationship with her. He knows he’s in the wrong and is hoping that she can forgive him for this moment.

An acoustic version was first included on John Mayer’s debut EP, Inside Wants Out. It was later re-recorded with a full band for Mayer’s 2001 full-length debut album Room for Squares.

description.plain:
“Split Screen Sadness” is the 7th track from John Mayer’s 2003 album, Heavier Things.

  


Two lovers have just had a quarrel and split. John sits around the phone playing out possible scenarios in his head, wondering what will become of their relationship. Regardless of who broke it off, there are two broken hearts. Like screen splits to portray distance in movies, each person is trying to separately heal in their own way– ‘Split Screen Sadness’.

description.plain: St. Patrick’s Day is about how usually when it gets towards the colder months of the year, people tend to get in to relationships because no one wants to be alone for the holidays; where companionship means the most. I.e: thanksgiving, Christmas, New Years Eve, Valentine’s Day etc. But, St. Patrick’s Day marks the end of these holidays, and people look forward to the summer; which is often looked at as the time to be single. John has gotten close to this girl that was suppose to only last until around St. Patrick’s Day, but as the year progresses he really starts to like this girl and as the day gets closer, it becomes much more harder to let go of her.

description.plain:
John Mayer is finally ready to let go of Jennifer Aniston – in song form, at least.

Although they broke up nearly three years ago, Mayer (whose exes also include Jessica Simpson and Jennifer Love Hewitt) penned his single “Shadow Days” (from the album Born and Raised) with Aniston in mind.

“Shadow Days is about Jen,” a source told Us Weekly. “It really took him a long time to get over her. He really loved her a lot.”

description.plain:
The sixth song of John Mayer’s debut album Room For Squares.
John tells a story of him living in New York City and the love-hate relationship he has with the city and with the city girl (Lydia).

The song begins with him disliking New York City, until he meets Lydia and she becomes apart of his life. As she leaves her belongs at his apartment and becomes more attached to John, to then explaining  the day when he realized the relationship was over.

And I can't remember life before her name

From the battery

And I can't remember life before her name

description.plain:
A deeply sincere song about finding satisfaction in life and being content with one’s place.

In a tongue-in-cheek manner, John begins by saying all the things he’ll do when he finally gets “around to living,” similar to how many of us have dreamed. In the latter half of the song, a wiser, presumably older John gives advice to his younger self: don’t waste your life constantly searching for something better.

description.plain: In this song, John is talking about a relationship that he was in that just couldn’t seem to work out. They’ve tried multiple times to work things out, but in the end, they always seem to just break up, and later on, get back together. After the last time, John was certain that they were done, but now that she has come back, like always, he does not know what to do, because whether they try or not, all they ever do is say goodbye.

description.plain:
The 5th track on Mayer’s second studio album, “Heavier Things” (2003)

John Mayer’s ode to the simple idea that whenever a woman is mad at a man, that man has NO idea what he did wrong. Even if he did do something wrong, all he wants is to cherish their time together before he “messes up again”

description.plain:
This song shares the same lyrical theme as a number of the other tracks on Battle Studies – love as a battle field. John told Rolling Stone though he didn’t set out to make a concept album, as it developed, he found the songs' war theme oddly appealing:

I was loving the war theme, the battle theme. The militaristic, vulgar, violent side of a relationship on the down slope, the record starts out sort of like the sun is out, then it gets darker. And then the sun comes back out at the end.

Theme from “The Search for Everything” is a short 2-minute instrumental with a country-rooted acoustic guitar in the lead, symphonic voices, electric guitar dipped in blues, strings and suppressed percussion from Steve Jordan.
It is a rollercoaster that executes well in its 2 minutes.

description.plain: Love Song for No One is, according to John, “about talking to the person you haven’t even met yet.” The singer is tired of being lonely and wants this person to appear. It’s a great song to remind you that there is someone for you out there, and you have to be ready for that person to come into your life". (Credit to songfacts.com)

description.plain:
“Do You Know Me” is a song by John Mayer from his fourth album Battle Studies. The wistful, folksy adult contemporary ballad is performed with brushed drums and ukelele. Its lyrics poetically capture the feeling of experiencing déjà vu with someone you have never met, but still have to ask, “Do you know me at all?”

Though the song clocks in at an efficient 2:30 minutes on record, when he performs it live, it gets far extended into an instrumental jam session trading solos with a saxophonist in his band.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rViDfPJfCMU

description.plain:
John covered the Ray Charles‘ song with his band during his summer tour in 2007 and recorded the live version on the album Where The Light Is.

The song was covered by the jazz guitar player John Scofield for his album That’s What I Say: John Scofield Plays the Music of Ray Charles in 2005, featuring John Mayer on additional guitar and vocals.

description.plain:
Released fresh off his second throat surgery, John Mayer pens “Go Easy On Me” to ask his fans to give him some time to bounce back.

Though he might appear strong on the outside and as if he is back to normal, Mayer says that he does not want to hear it from anybody, that he is trying to get back to himself and return for his fans.

He admits that the process has scarred him and that he is weaker than before, and he asks for kindness to him while he recovers. He also admits that he and his fans may not be on the same page and that they don’t mean to hurt him, and Mayer once again asks for a little leniency from his faithful.

description.plain: “Man on the Side” while not particularly known by many John Mayer listeners, is one of the first songs John wrote at the start of his career. While not on any of his main studio albums, the song appears on his first live album, “Any Given Thursday” with an instrumental cover of “Lenny (Stevie Ray Vaughan)” before moving into the song. The song describes his short crush on a girl at Berklee College Of Music, where John attended. The girl repeatedly put him off and treated him as a “man on the side”, which led John to write this song.

description.plain:
“Lenny” is a beautiful instrumental created by Stevie Ray Vaughan and Double Trouble. It When appeared on their debut album “Texas Flood” in 1983. The title “Lenny” came from Stevie’s wife Lenora Bailey-Vaughan. She bought and suprised Stevie with a guitar on his birthday. She went into his room while he was asleep and suprised him. According to Lenora, Stevie wrote Lenny on the bed with his guitar that he got. “Lenny” consists of beautiful chords and warm melodies in my opinion.

In 2001, John Mayer’s “Room of Squares: Special edition” was released and on it, John did a shorter version of “Lenny”.

“Man on the Side” was one of the first songs John had ever written. It doesn’t appear on any of his albums except “Any Given Thursday” along with John’s cover of “Lenny”. According to John, he wrote the song about this girl that he liked while he attended Berklee (which he eventually dropped out from). The girl liked John but whenever John called her, she wouldn’t pick up because she would be with another guy. That’s why John feels like he’s the “Man on the Side”.

description.plain: “This is about when you’re just meeting somebody and you’re in your certain role of the relationship – "hey I’m just meetin' ya” – and the other person’s like a vampire and they kind of burrow their way into you and you’re like “what’s going on?” They just move too fast for you, and they’re really snakey, and the next thing you know they’re like, “Ah, I feel so comfortable with you.” It’s like, in 14 minutes? Shit. So this is for all those people that just can’t slow down and accept that you’ve just known someone for a week and it’s a good week and it’ll be a month and that’ll be a year and just take your damn time.“ – John Mayer on this song, July 2004 at his Mountainview, CA show

description.plain:
In a series of Instagram stories, John released what could be considered the greatest pop song of 2017– “I Pet Your Cat a New Way”. John obviously wanted the song’s lyrics to be featured on Genius as he even included his own transcriptions of the lyrics with the Genius logo at the top. Here is a link to a screen recording of the Instagram story

https://twitter.com/BrandonRayMusic/status/945311461173317633

songs.lyrics:
Me and all my friends
We're all misunderstood
They say we stand for nothing
And there's no way we ever could
Now we see everything that's going wrong
With the world and those who lead it
We just feel like we don't have the means
To rise above and beat it

So we keep waiting
Waiting on the world to change
We keep on waiting
Waiting on the world to change
It's hard to beat the system
When we're standing at a distance
So we keep waiting

songs.lyrics:

Daughters will love like you do

So mothers, be good to your daughters too
Oh, you see that skin?
It's the same she's been standing in
Since the day she saw him walking away
Now she's left
Cleaning up the mess he made
So fathers, be good to your daughters
Daughters will love like you do
Girls become lovers who turn into mothers
So mothers, be good to your daughters too
Boys, you can break

And boys soldier on

Looking out for every girl
You are the guide and the weight of her world
So fathers, be good to your daughters
Daughters will love like you do
Girls become lovers who turn into mothers
So mothers, be good to your daughters too

description.plain:
“Can’t Take That Plane” is a song by Mayer that was originally meant to be the opening track on his third studio album, Continuum.

The track was included on the iTunes pre-release of the album, back in 2006. However, the song was ultimately removed from the final tracklist.

body.plain:
“Can’t Take That Plane” is a song by Mayer that was originally meant to be the opening track on his third studio album, Continuum.

The track was included on the iTunes pre-release of the album, back in 2006. However, the song was ultimately removed from the final tracklist.

songs.lyrics:
Bought a ticket for a trip I wanted long ago
Staring deep into crying eyes
Said goodbye, stood in line, now I changed my mind
I used to run and never look behind

But now, now I've got a love to leave
And now, not gonna walk away so easily

I can't take that plane, I can't take that
I can't take that plane today
I can't take that plane, I can't take that plane

Plane lands short a man on the other side
Driver stands with a sign in faith
Checks his watch as he size up the time gone by
Two lonely pieces circle baggage claim

But yeah, now I've got a love to leave
And yeah, don't you know it changes
Everything, everything

I can't take that plane, I can't take that
I can't take that plane today
I can't take that plane, I can't take that plane

No, I can't, I can't
I can't, I can't

I'm coming to getcha, I'm coming to getcha now
I'm coming to getcha, I'm coming to getcha now

songs.lyrics:
I'm not alone, I wish I was
'Cause then I'd know I was down because
I couldn't find a friend around
To love me like they do right now, they do right now
I'm dizzy from the shopping mall
I searched for joy but I bought it all
It doesn't help the hunger pains
And a thirst I'd have to drown first to ever satiate
Something's missing and I don't know how to fix it
Something's missing and I don't know what it is
No, I don't know what it is at all
When Autumn comes, it doesn't ask
It just walks in where it left you last
You never know when it starts
Until there's fog inside the glass around your summer heart
Something's missing and I don't know how to fix it
Something's missing and I don't know what it is
No, I don't know what it is at all
I can't be sure that this state of mind
Is not of my own design
I wish there was an over the counter test
For loneliness, for loneliness like this
Something's missing and I don't know how to fix it
Something's missing and I don't know what it is
No, I don't know what it is
Something's different and I don't know what it is
No, I don't know what it is
Friends, check
Money, check
Well-slept, check
Opposite sex, check
Guitar, check
Microphone, check
Messages waiting on me
When I come home, check
How come everything I think I need
Always comes with batteries?
What do you think it means?
How come everything I think I need

songs.lyrics:
"Welcome to the real world", she said to me
Condescendingly
"Take a seat, take your life
Plot it out in black and white"
Well I never lived the dreams of the prom kings
And the drama queens
I'd like to think the best of me
Is still hiding up my sleeve
They love to tell you "stay inside the lines"
But something's better on the other side
I wanna run through the halls of my high school
I wanna scream at the top of my lungs
I just found out there's no such thing
As the real world
Just a lie you've got to rise above
So the good boys and girls take
The so called right track
Faded white hats
Grabbing credits, and maybe transfers
They read all the books but they can't
Find the answers
And all of our parents
They're getting older
I wonder if they've wished for anything better
While in their memories
Tiny tragedies
They love to tell you "stay inside the lines"
But something's better on the other side
I wanna run through the halls of my high school
I wanna scream at the
Top of my lungs
I just found out there's no such thing
As the real world
Just a lie you got to rise above
I am invincible as long as I'm alive
I wanna run through the halls of my high school
I wanna scream at the top of my lungs
I just found out there's no such thing
As the real world
Just a lie you've got to rise above
I just can't wait 'til my 10 year reunion
I'm gonna bust down the double doors
And when I stand on these tables before you
You will know what all this time was for

Now the cover of Rolling Stone
Ain't the cover of a Rolling Stone

Make me feel as I am free

I don't want a world of broken things
You can tell that something isn't right
When all your heroes are in black and white
What a drag to say
At least I still have yesterday

songs.lyrics:
I know a girl
She puts the color inside of my world
But she's just like a maze
Where all of the walls all continually change
And I've done all I can
To stand on her steps with my heart in my hands
Now I'm starting to see
Maybe it's got nothing to do with me
Fathers, be good to your daughters
Daughters will love like you do
Girls become lovers who turn into mothers
So mothers, be good to your daughters too
Oh, you see that skin?
It's the same she's been standing in
Since the day she saw him walking away
Now she's left
Cleaning up the mess he made
So fathers, be good to your daughters
Daughters will love like you do
Girls become lovers who turn into mothers
So mothers, be good to your daughters too
Boys, you can break
You'll find out how much they can take
Boys will be strong
And boys soldier on
But boys would be gone without warmth from
A woman's good, good heart
On behalf of every man
Looking out for every girl
You are the guide and the weight of her world
So fathers, be good to your daughters
Daughters will love like you do
Girls become lovers who turn into mothers
So mothers, be good to your daughters too

songs.lyrics:
After all the jacks are in their boxes
And the clowns have all gone to bed
You can hear happiness staggering on down the street
Footsteps dressed in red
And the wind whispers Mary
A broom is drearily sweeping
Up the broken pieces of yesterdays life
Somewhere a queen is weeping
Somewhere a king has no wife
And the wind, it cries Mary
The traffic lights, they turn, uh, blue tomorrow
And shine their emptiness down on my bed
The tiny island sags down stream
'cause the life that lived is
Is dead
And the wind screams Mary
Uh-will the wind ever remember
The names it has blow in the past?
And with this crutch, its old age, and its wisdom
It whispers no, this will be the last
And the wind cries Mary

A night in my mind

Something's missing and I don't know how to fix it
Something's missing and I don't know what it is
No, I don't know what it is at all
I can't be sure that this state of mind
Is not of my own design
I wish there was an over the counter test
For loneliness, for loneliness like this
Something's missing and I don't know how to fix it
Something's missing and I don't know what it is
No, I don't know what it is

No, I don't know what it is

Money, check
Well-slept, check
Opposite sex, check
Guitar, check
Microphone, check
Messages waiting on me
When I come home, check
How come everything I think I need
Always comes with batteries?
What do you think it means?
